DataElement.preferredName: Patient Corticosteroid Use Personal Medical History Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to a patient's personal medical history taking hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Corticosteroid Use Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient's personal medical history taking hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).(NCI):Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Do you use corticosteroids fo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do you use corticosteroids for a chronic condition

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have chronic daily treatment with corticosteroids with a dose >= 10 mg/day methylprednisolone equivalent (excluding inhaled steroids)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive corticosteroids for lymphoma symptom control?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a chronic medical condition requiring a higher dose of corticosteroid (prednisone/prednisolone) than 10 mg once daily?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient use topical corticosteroids, inhaled corticosteroids and mineralocorticoids for a chronic condition (orthostatic hypotension/adrenocortical insufficiency is allowed)?

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Therapy Ind-2 2018279v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
